Petition subject: Property

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:26855746

Date of creation: 1667

Total signatures: 0

Males of color signatures: 0

Female only signatures: No

Identifications of signatories: wee youoor poore petitioners, [males of color]

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Native American tribe: Nipmuc

Acknowledgements: Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities (PW-5105612), Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University, Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University, Institutional Development Initiative at Harvard University, and Harvard University Library.

Additional archivist notes: Nipmuc Indians, Nipmuck Indians, redress on account of ill treatment by Narragansett Indians, Sachem, Boston, John Eliot, agriculture, food, corn, wigwam, houses, fort, deer skins, hog, swine, powder, shot, guns, trays, garments, spoons, kettles, wampum, coats, cotton, Quantisset, Squaw Sachem, widow of Meexano, [Mixan?], mother of Sachem Scutabee, [Scuttup?], Watowswokotaus, Quaiapen, date of creation from index to volume, [many details, including name, see document], [additional documents in volumes, see pages 138-142]

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Massachusetts Archives volume 30, pages 138a-138b
